Specialist Tuition

GCSE Maths Tuition

Building confidence and securing top grades for Year 10 & 11 students.

Check Availability View Curriculum
THE REALITY

Why students struggle at this level.

  • The common belief: 'I'm just not a maths person' (Maths Anxiety).
  • Losing easy marks due to 'silly mistakes' or misreading the question.
  • Struggling with the jump in difficulty from Year 9 to Year 10.
  • Uncertainty about whether to sit the Higher or Foundation paper.
The GG Method

How we secure the top grades.

  • Confidence First: We build momentum by starting with quick wins, proving to the student that they can do it.
  • The 'Silly Mistake' Checklist: A personalized protocol to check answers and save 10-15 marks per paper.
  • Calculator Mastery: Teaching specific Casio hacks to verify answers instantly.
  • Board-Specific Wording: decoding exactly what AQA or Edexcel examiners are asking for.
Secure your GCSE Maths Grade

More Than Just Tutoring

A holistic approach designed for high performance.

Gap Filling

GCSE struggles often stem from a gap in Year 7/8 basics. We identify these invisible holes and fill them so the advanced topics finally make sense.

Active Recall

We don't just read the textbook. We use rapid-fire questioning at the start of every lesson to ensure formulas (like Area of a Circle) are never forgotten.

Exam Technique

We teach the 'art' of the exam: which questions to skip and return to, how to show working for partial marks, and how to manage time.

Proven Results at this Level

Common Questions

Should my child do Higher or Foundation?

This is a strategic decision. Foundation is capped at Grade 5. If your child is currently working at a Grade 4/5, we often recommend securing a strong Foundation pass rather than risking a low grade on Higher. We can assess this for you.

Do you cover IGCSE?

Yes. Many private schools sit the Edexcel or Cambridge IGCSE. We are fully familiar with the slight differences in syllabus (e.g., differentiation is included in IGCSE).

My child has lost all confidence. Can you help?

Confidence is our primary metric. We start with topics they are comfortable with to build a 'winning streak' before tackling the harder concepts. The change in attitude is usually immediate.

How many sessions a week do we need?

For most GCSE students, 1 hour per week is sufficient if they also use our Portal for homework. In the final term before exams, many increase to 2 hours.
